column4: should it take me 15 minutes to copy a 2.5gb file from one computer to another on a wired 100mbit network?
so that's not too long? my network's not "slow"?
it is a bit slow but not out of the normal
whats the infrastructure of your network?
is there a new higher-speed protocol in the works? if I wanted a "fast" network, how would I get one?
a few PCs...  netgear router...  cable modem
clearly the netgear router its not built for that
it's a wireless + wired network router
if you want to speed up you net a switch and of course gigabit lan dies a great job...
what does the switch do for me?
what's the difference between a router and a switch?
basically a switch is used to connect a network internally
as a difference to a router that is used to route to the outworld as the name mimplies
so what would I buy and how would I deploy it in my home network?  I have 4 desktops PCs and 2 laptops (wireless)
best switchhub if cou can afford:)
